data.label: Everest Expedition
data.description: Even though the highest mountain in the world has been conquered many times in these forty-six years since the first ascent, it remains a daunting challenge.

data.label: Lhotse Expedition
data.description: Lhotse, which means 'south peaks,' is part of the Everest massif, located 3km south of Mount Everest.

data.label: Manaslu Expedition
data.description: This trek was officially opened to tourists in 1991, but mountaineering expeditions have had long access to the area. Manaslu offers a challenging yet rewarding experience.

data.label: Annapurna Expedition
data.description: Annapurna is a Sanskrit word meaning 'Sustenance' and 'filled with,' symbolizing the mountain's grandeur and abundance.

data.label: Pumari Expedition
data.description: To the Northwest of Nepal lies the fascinating land of the legendary Sherpas. In this land of mountains, Pumori stands as a beautiful and challenging peak.

data.label: Amadablam Expedition
data.description: Ama Dablam has long been considered the prettiest mountain in the world. High on her Southwest face hangs a glacier resembling a jewel box.
